website_summaries.verdict: This high-top boot from Oboz has proven its readiness for cold winter hikes. Those who primarily seek comfort and warmth on their outdoor ventures will surely enjoy its confines. It was also complimented for its low weight and supportive build. It, however, loses points for running small. Nevertheless, with these satisfying features of the Bridger 10” Insulated BDry, sizing up won’t be an issue.
pros: According to most owners, they liked how the Bridger 10” Insulated BDry kept their foot warm in freezing temperatures
The cozy feel of this winter hiking boot was appreciated by the majority
Several online buyers were surprised with its lightness considering its tall build
The minimal-to-no break-in period of this Oboz footgear delighted some wearers
A few users commended its sticky outsole
An outdoor enthusiast praised the ankle support of the Oboz Bridger 10" Insulated BDry
He attributed it to the high-cut design of the boot
A handful of customers declared that they loved its fit
cons: A very small portion of verified purchasers mentioned that it runs a bit small

customer_reviews.title: These are the best! Oboz are the new go to boot company!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in women's style for myself and mens as a gift. The arch support is top notch best boot out there. I will be purchasing hiking shoes next; they have 2 new customers for life. I will say that the women's is not as warm as I would like them to be so hopefully they come out with a warmer boot for women with extremely cold feet:) I have been told the mens boot is very warm.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wait a few months before reviewing, and I’ll do a follow up, but have to say after a month, I’m super satisfied! I started wearing them to try and break them in, as I have to do with most shoes. Except Meryls. And apparently, except for these! They have been so amazingly comfortable, there’s been no break in. And they are very very warm. I haven’t dealt with snow, but I’ve dealt with rain and they are airtight. Very happy with these Boots!
customer_reviews.author: Richard John Nagel

customer_reviews.title: Run small. No wide sizes.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this boot. I wear a 12 in boots and 13 in gym shoes. I ordered a 13 but would probably go with 14 (because the boot is so narrow and there are NO WIDE SIZES) if I could afford another pair. If not for sizing I would rate 5 stars. very warm for 400g insulation. Very good tread and ok to wear to work right out of the box. I skipped the bottom lace to take pressure off of forefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Servos

customer_reviews.title: Not so good in sheet ice.
customer_reviews.text: OK this boot is extremely comfortable and warm but my 5 went to a 3 the first snowfall in Spokane,WA. We get a lot of sheet ice! Like literally 100 yards.long in high traffic areas and shade. These underperformed. Almost lost it a couple times going from dry sidewalk to iced parking lot. Hope they keep this review. Last one was taken down although it wa as a 5 on rugged trails and variable terrain in dry conditions.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots for hiking in the southern Rockies. They are warm, comfortable, have good traction and as far as I can tell pretty water-proof. They do run small. I was able to try them on at a shoe store in Maine before I bought them and I had to get size 11 when I usually wear size nine. I like these boots as they were comfortable right out of the box and are light weight. After having them for a few months I would like to add a few more comments ,one being the laces never come undone and they appear to be waterproof. They only question that remains is durability,time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: J. Deschenes

customer_reviews.title: Very light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These boots weigh almost nothing compared to my old snow boots. I can walk without feeling like I have weights on my feet. They are also very very comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.author: J Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy boot
customer_reviews.text: Love this boot very comfortable and solid on the heel. I’m a size 13 on the wider side and the 14 fits perfect with regular merino socks. I can wear my really thick wool socks but it is tight. Good enough for hanging at camp on really cold nights
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Great boots! Warm, waterproof, good grip, and comfortable right out of the box. Wore on a trip to Iceland and they performed flawlessly, even walking through ankle deep flowing water. Have worn them in 5 degree F weather with warm socks and never felt the cold. The 10” height is great and very supportive. They are a little bulky for certain ice cleats, but there are some that fit if you get the larger sizes. These are the best boots I’ve ever had, and I’ve had a lot! I just wish they made an uninsulated 10” version. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ZZ

customer_reviews.title: Best boot ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fit like a glove right out of the box. Waterproof right up to the top of the boot! I can walk for miles and my feet are perfect temp with comfort unsurpassed! Definitely the best boot ever!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mikey214

customer_reviews.title: These boots kick butt!
customer_reviews.text: Size is true and fit is perfect! Needed a cold weather boot for work where ice is a possibility and these have delivered! Pricey, but worth it if you need it in a 10" height. Could opt for an 8" height otherwise and get the same results. I've been a fan of Oboz for a few years and it's now the benchmark in footwear for me.
customer_reviews.author: Boba T Fett

customer_reviews.title: Great boot!!
customer_reviews.text: Hiked 20 + miles in deep snow and in the mountains with gators on and worked perfect best boot I have ever owned!!!!
customer_reviews.author: kyle kirkland

customer_reviews.title: great snow boots
customer_reviews.text: Been using these in the snow for hiking in deep snow and ice. These are great. They have a great grip, also provide great support and protection for your feet. On top these are super confortable.
customer_reviews.author: David Wright

customer_reviews.title: very well made boot, but runs small
customer_reviews.text: solid construction, water proof, comfortable but order one size larger.
customer_reviews.author: robert long

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but oboz nothing compares
customer_reviews.text: Would buy again and again. Great show, water proof, and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Well designed
customer_reviews.text: Extremely warm and comfortable with lots of support. Great for snowshoeing.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Moore

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and very warm. One of the best purchases ever. Purchased a size larger, and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Best cold weather boots I have ever worn
customer_reviews.text: I wore these while hiking a glacier in Alaska in -22 degree weather. My toes were toasty. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The size was perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very warm boot fit as expected . A little uncomfortable up top where the boots lace up but all in all a very good boot!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Joshua Johns

customer_reviews.title: Awesome so far
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and fairly comfortable right out of the box. I may update once I've worn them awhile and broken them in.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Decent winter boot
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an insulated, slightly taller, low volume boot to keep my toes from freezing while fat biking. My toes do get a little cool riding in single digit temps but they are not cold so for me that is a win. The boots are fairly stiff out of the box and take a little breaking in and as others have mentioned they do run a little small.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Tough - warm - Waterproof- and you can comfortably hike in them or tie on your snowshoes- also great for snowmobiling
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome overall boot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair to hike in the backcountry during winter. Great durability, comfort and flexible without sacrificing warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Good Boot
customer_reviews.text: I just wore them this weekend and they worked out well. They do tend to run small and I was glad I order 1/2 a size bigger than my hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Conroy

customer_reviews.title: Boots worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great fit boots. I like that the heel is a little more narrow so it stays put. I have tested these out on deep snow and they performed well.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Moore

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Lowa man, and these are probably better support
customer_reviews.text: Good solid support. Easy break in, light. S uprised .
customer_reviews.author: David James

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable boots ever had
customer_reviews.text: I got UGG for men, columbia bugaboot iv omniheat and these to compare. I haven’t tried them for winter yet but comfortwise the other didn’t even compete. These are as comfy as wearing sport shoes. It wraps up your feet without making you uncomfortable. Even the first time wearing it didn’t have that “you have to break in to get comfortable”
customer_reviews.author: Cankat

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: These fit awesome and have ample room for my toes. For me that’s a big thing. Well made. Love em.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brownell

customer_reviews.title: Love these and their insoles!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Very warm. Keep your feet dry. Work great as a cold/wet weather hiking boot. The insoles seem especially unique, not just how they are constructed with materials to keep your feet warm but they also have a nice arch build making the boot very good for me and my collapsed arches. I love that they came with a second set of replacement insoles if you ever need them.
customer_reviews.author: SilverFire

customer_reviews.title: I wear a size 12, I was told to get one size up, I did. Thank the person who told me this!
customer_reviews.text: Great Boot, I do not have large shins, these boots are even greater for those who do.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for good hunting boots that could handle mountain terrain as well as be comfortable on long flat stretches. I tried Lowa, Honwag, and other hunting style boots and none fit or feel as good on my feet as these do. I have not tested then other than just inside the house but will update after a mountain hunt in a couple of weeks. I wear size 9.5 tennis shoe and these 9.5 boots fit perfect. So, back from the mountain hunt and these boots performed flawlessly. My feet stayed warm and dry the entire time and I have no complaints about anything. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: UltimateReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, waterproof, and warm.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a year ago for a trip to Norway and they artic circle. I love the boots. I tried 4 other brands before I selected these. I bought them because: they look good; they are comfortable; they open wide so it is very easy to put them on; even though they open wide, when laced up, they fit snug around my calves; they are warm; and they are completely waterproof. I wore them recently for the first time this fall and got them pretty dirty. I took a water hose and sprayed them full blast for a minute or so each to clean them while they were on my feet. My feet remained completely dry.
customer_reviews.author: E. McClain

customer_reviews.title: Bought a 10 thinking they would be good with an extra sock
customer_reviews.text: Usually wear a size 9.5. Bought a 10 thinking they would be good with an extra sock. Had to return them cause a ten was TOO small and tight with even a light sock.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof (no wet feet)  through lots of snow.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing boots. I’m a part time Amazon delivery driver and I was delivering for over 11 hours running through snow all day. At the end of the day my socks were totally dry. Fantastic! They seem durable but I’ll know it time. They do run smaller in length and I upsized to an 11 and a half. They do have half sized and also wide. They run narrow too, so I bought the wide. Lots of comfy room and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was pretty disappointed with that
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for about a month and one of the lace eyelets broke off. I was pretty disappointed with that. Other than that, the boots are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Not great very extreme cold!!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great however in very low temperatures your feet will freeze. So DO NOT recommend for temperate below -10 degrees Fahrenheit
customer_reviews.author: Przemek Grabowski

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves them. Wears them every day to hike with the dogs. Perfect for MN snow and cold. Keeps his feet warm and dry. Great traction.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Kapler

product_meta.title: Oboz mens Bridger 10" Insulated Bdry
product_meta.description: With clowns to the left of you and jokers to the right, sometimes you have to make your way down the middle through a cold trench of muck and mire. Turn the slog into a cakewalk with DWR treated nubuck leather, waterproof/breathable B-DRY Lining, and 400 grams of foot-toasting Thinsulate. Cold-traction optimized rubber prevents a slide back down that slippery slope.
feature_bullets: O FIT Insole Thermal: Our proprietary insole is what we're known for. Molded to match the specific shape and construction of every pair we make, this purpose-designed technology delivers the kind of fit, feel and performance that's unmatched in the industry. These thermal insoles feature an insulated top sheet for warmth and a Mylar bottom sheet to reflect heat back to your foot, keeping toes nice and cozy.

UPPER: Waterproof all-nubuck leather provide protection and durability on the trail. Featuring a molded rubber toe cap that protects your toes from trail debris and a heel counter that helps maintain a snug, Comfort heel hold over time.

GRANITE PEAK MIDSOLE: Great for day hiking but burly enough for a multi-day backpacking trip. Featuring a TPU Chassis boosts stability and prevents stone bruising without inhibiting flex. Single-density EVA provides cushioning and comfort.

GRANITE PEAK WINTERIZED OUTSOLE: Our quintessential hiking outsole built to be supportive and protective. Featuring our winterized rubber for increased grip in the cold. If you're tired of feeling rocks and roots underfoot look no further.

B-DRY Waterproof/Breathable: There's no denying feet sweat and trails can get muddy. There's also no denying the ability of our proprietary waterproofing system, B-DRY, lets sweat escape while keeping moisture out.

specifications.Usage: Walking, Backpacking, Waterproof Multi-Sport, Outdoor, Hiking
specifications.Customer Reviews: 5.0 out of 5 stars2 ratings5.0 out of 5 stars
